alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; East Sweetwater County; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Rock Springs and Green River; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Upper Green River Basin; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 9:37AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARK...WESTERN BIG HORN...HOT SPRINGS WESTERN FREMONT...SUBLETTE AND WESTERN SWEETWATER COUNTY... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. At 934 AM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Crandall Creek to 12 miles northeast of Valley to 7 miles southwest of Big Sandy to 12 miles north of Granger and moving east at 45 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Beartooth Pass around 950 AM MST. Big Sandy Opening around 955 AM MST. Meeteetse, Clark and Meeteetse Rim around 1010 AM MST. Christina Lake, Fiddlers Lake and Upper Silas Lake around 1020 AM MST. South Pass City and Louis Lake around 1025 AM MST. Elk Basin around 1030 AM MST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
